title.narrative: HWF Safe Migration and Rights Training (SMART Youth Project) 2017

description.narrative: SMART Youth Project Project aims The SMART Youth Project has been created to train, promote, educate, advocate on safe migration and allow access to all youth and their migrant communities involved with this project to information and learnings that will help for a civil society to flourish and grow with that knowledge together. Problem analysis Thailand has been a destination and transit country for many migrants from Myanmar for decades as they flee conflict and extreme poverty in their home country. Migrant children and youths from Burma either live or go to Thailand for working without any knowledge and education. They are high risk to become a victim of human trafficking, sexual exploitation and unsafe migrants Project objectives  1. Providing capacity building for civil society organisations, which will include mechanisms to ensure the promotion and protection of human rights, including the rights of expression, rights of safe migration   2. Ensure youth are empowered with the understanding of basic human rights commitments and the ensuing awareness and advocacy of those human rights Project main activities Training of trainers (ToT), development of modules on safe migration and child protection, promote, educate, and advocate on safe migration. Expected results 1. CSO’s trained and skilled in being able to teach and advocate on the selected topics in order for them to be able to reach vulnerable youth before they drop out and migrate, utilizing peer educators and technology to reach out-of-school and migrant youth to ensure shared knowledge 2. Peer youth group and CSO Human Right ambassadors created at local levels to ensure shared information and advocacy on current human rights commitments Main thematic. Child rights, human trafficking, and safe migration.
This project mainly contributes to results within Empowerment of human rights defenders. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
